xwikidoc.title: Debugging XWiki using Eclipse WTP
xwikidoc.content:
The goal of this tutorial is to describe a way to setup Eclipse to be able to :
* edit web files (javascript, images, ...) in and automatically publish them in a running instance of XWiki without restarting it * edit and debug java without restarting XWiki instance
All these tricks helps to improve the programming speed a lot.
{{toc/}}
= Prerequisites =
If it's not already done you should take a look at [[Working with Eclipse>>Community.BuildingInEclipse]] for the base setup of Eclipse for XWiki.
= Setting Eclipse for debug =
To be able to launch XWiki into Eclipse and debug it we will create a WTP project which will be a mirror of the product web we want to work on. Here it's [[XWiki Enterprise Manager>>http://manager.xwiki.org]].
1. [[Mirror XEM war>>DebugXEWithEclipse_MirrorWeb]] 1. [[Import and link maven jar projects to debug>>DebugXEWithEclipse_ImportJarProjects]] 1. [[Start Debug Project>>DebugXEWithEclipse_WebStart]] 1. [[Troubleshoots>>DebugXEWithEclipse_Troubleshoots]] 1. Enjoy :)
